cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast, cross the Florida Big Bend on Thursday, then track northeastward across Georgia and hug/parallel the South Carolina coast before moving offshore toward the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachicola–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL, then Atlantic coasts of GA and the Carolinas, including the South Carolina low-country
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible Friday with gusts near 50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of roughly 2–4 ft possible near high tide along Charleston Harbor and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall totals of 3–6 inches with localized amounts over 4 inches could lead to urban and low-lying flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents; possible short-lived tornadoes embedded in rain bands.
